children.subject: What are the other two majors? Many cs people I know have done CS + Stats + IEOR or Math

history.content:
I did this last year (also declared CS, adding two new majors simultaneously). I submitted the double major application form, but with an extra copy of page 3 for my third major.

So, I didn't treat it as two (or three) separate double major applications.

~~~~

Different responder: I did the same but in two parts (declared a double and then later a triple) and I needed two separate packets. Might be able to skip that if you're declaring simultaneously though.

I did this last year (also declared CS, adding two new majors simultaneously). I submitted the double major application form, but with an extra copy of page 3 for my third major.

So, I didn't treat it as two (or three) separate double major applications.

Hi. I'm solely declared in L&S as a CS major. I'm currently a sophomore. 

I wish to declare two more majors, both within L&S. And yes, I have thoroughly done my research on and have planned out my schedule with enough thinking to know I want to do this. 

I plan to submit forms for both majors within the next few weeks. I know this Piazza is for CS, so I'm just asking about the CS side. Do I prepare a double major packet for 'CS + Other Major 1' and another double major packet for 'CS + Other Major 2' to show to my CS advisor?

I've heard from an alumnus that I just need one double packet, but will squeeze in information for all three majors on that packet. However, she graduated a while ago, so I don't know if this is still valid.
history.subject: Submitting forms for triple major?
